item.title: Robot
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Good topology just matters what you are using it for. I’m mot saying you shouldn’t have nice topology, as that isn’t good practice, but if you are just doing a render and nothing else, it won’t hurt the outcome. However, if you plan on animating you better have great topology. I think that is why that guys tutorials or whatnot had bad topology.

@OP I agree with everyone else that he should have some more badass arms and legs, that the metal tubes just don’t “wow” me. However I like the body concept. And I also have no imagination so I can’t give you any ideas.

Read full topic

item.title: Robot
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

dylan_0789:

As someone who is a topology nut, this makes me sad

Ever since I started using Cinema 4D, polygon efficiency has become less of a worry of mine. It’s an awful habit to just segment the shit out of something and leave it.
iDigitalUniverse(youtube link) was a huge inspiration for me when I was starting, and he teaches sloppy habits for being poly-efficient. I don’t think that’s really a worry for him, because the only thing he worries about is the render (as far as I know).

dylan_0789:

in which case I would assume he has HUGE feet.

You would be correct, although they look awful. I’d been at a loss for what would pass as “robot feet”, so I just threw something together real quick.

dylan_0789:

Edit can you post a wire frame please?

I’m going to work on reducing the polygons, since the wireframe right now is at the point of most things appearing black, as they’ve been segmented so much. Once I’ve reduced them to the point of being visible to judge, I’ll post a wireframe.

Read full topic

item.title: Robot
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

Cole1497:

65k, with tons of unnecessary loop cuts.

As someone who is a topology nut, this makes me sad although I’m sure it would be an easy fix if you planned to.
Looks decent over all, but I must say that the arms look off. I just don’t “Feel” them, if you catch my drift. I personally would look into re-conceptializing the robot. The legs are better, but I feel you could have done more with them too. I understand it is a robot, but I just cant see the arms and legs being, well, arms and legs. He doesn’t seem “balanced,” his center of gravity feels top heavy, in which case I would assume he has HUGE feet. If you scale the bottom of the legs out so that it tapers, it should feel more sturdy, a good reference to that would be mega mans legs.

Also, I am being pretty picky, but thats only because I’m speaking from one modeler to another, not to someone in the midst of learning the basics. Loving the body by the way.

Edit can you post a wire frame please?

Read full topic

item.title: Robot
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:14, topic:443116”]The modeling is the easiest. You can easily identify the primitives used and what was done with them.

I started with a few spheres roated 90 degrees, did some extruding on them after deleting a few segments, made the lense looking thing out of another sphere, the “eye” is also a sphere. The joints on the sides of the body are a few extruded cylinders, the joints are slightly shaped spheres, the “bones” are extruded cylinders, and the gun is just a bunch more extruding.[/quote]
I’ll look into more when I get older, but thanks for this information!

Read full topic

item.title: Robot
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

The modeling is the easiest. You can easily identify the primitives used and what was done with them.

I started with a few spheres roated 90 degrees, did some extruding on them after deleting a few segments, made the lense looking thing out of another sphere, the “eye” is also a sphere. The joints on the sides of the body are a few extruded cylinders, the joints are slightly shaped spheres, the “bones” are extruded cylinders, and the gun is just a bunch more extruding.

Read full topic
